lexUnit.name: order.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an authoritative command or direction; a verbal or written request for something to be made, supplied, or served

sentence.text: Where a court order is made , it is not sufficient for a copy of that to be placed with the title deeds with nothing further being done , for the court order can be misplaced or removed .
The Metropolitan Police Commissioner , Paul Condon , has called for a review of deportation procedures following the death of a Jamaican woman after a deportation order was served .
If you intend to buy mail order , make sure you are familiar with the shoe and the correct size or send in an outline of your foot to help the supplier .
An exclusion zone order was last used to keep revellers away from Stonehenge .
It enables him to consider , no doubt on advice , whether there are grounds for challenging the findings made by the judge who made the order .
` She does not take orders too well , " Alain growled with a sidelong glance at Jenna 's mutinous face .
Already under a probation order for attacking a songwriter the previous year , he found himself on another assault charge .
The girl was also fined £30 and given a 12 month supervision order for breaching a conditional discharge given last year for a burglary at a cycle shop .
HOW silly of comedy writer Carla Lane to try to save a pit bull terrier which faces an automatic destruction order after being unmuzzled in public .
On the way down the stairs they passed a maid and he issued very firm orders without stopping for one second .
On the back seat … a fourteen-year-old boy from Milton Keynes , who just the day before had been given a supervision order after being convicted for burglary , armed robbery and car theft .
Ray McClean describes his mild surprise on several occasions , when demonstrators accepted the authority of his steward 's armband and obeyed his orders .
AILING Liz Taylor has cancelled her traditional Christmas break on doctor 's orders .
The registrar 's order was overturned ( see ACCOUNTANCY , September 1991 , p 41 ) .
Sensing a certain self-irritation in Bodie 's tone of voice , Cowley said quickly , firmly , ` They were my orders , Bodie .
We are here on the regent 's orders ! "
Loretta gave her order , intending to tag her question about Veronica Puddephat on the end , but was baulked by the woman 's suggestive banter with the two men seated at the bar .
